header_summary:
Antoine Poinsot initiated a discussion on the Bitcoin Development Mailing List regarding the Consensus Cleanup proposal to mitigate the risk of duplicate coinbase transactions by modifying transaction elements such as nLocktime, nSequence, and ensuring a witness commitment. This initiative seeks feedback from mining industry stakeholders and engineers to prevent potential issues stemming from BIP30 verification and BIP34's block height requirement in coinbase transactions, highlighting the technological advancements and challenges within the Bitcoin network [source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/cLJjA4Em1sfbLHBctwsPUvquk8uMGGnXt2zGx7mn_JNu5F-HULjtdsBQjX9VET6MVRhbzJExPRrwNKBeLV1S30uEgCtFiBmMPVuzTFVNxkY=@protonmail.com).

Antoine Riard provided insights into compiling Windows on ARM architecture for bitcoin core development, emphasizing the need for cross-platform compilation and the potential integration of RISC-V support. This discussion sheds light on technical intricacies and the development process of the bitcoin core's libbitcoinkernel engine, highlighting ongoing developments within the bitcoin programming community at [bitcoindev](https://groups.google.com/g/bitcoindev/c/fOIByS6COMk).

A new tool for exploring Bitcoin Inquisition transactions has been developed, designed to enhance analysis capabilities. Open for feedback, this tool represents an investigative effort to better understand transaction dynamics, available at [https://inquisition.observer](https://inquisition.observer). Meanwhile, discussions around the unsigned TLV format for SPV proof and the structure of feature bits reveal collaborative efforts and debates on improving transaction informational richness and network adoption, illustrating the community's role in fostering innovation and addressing technical concerns [source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/updates-to-the-gossip-1-75-proposal-post-ln-summit-meeting/1202/3).

Lastly, a discussion initiated by ariard delves into professional reputation, open-source community dynamics, and ethical considerations, highlighting a dispute involving Rusty Russell and concerns over conflict of interest protections within open-source projects. This discussion raises critical questions about the integrity of open-source contributions and the impact of political activism on technical communities, underscoring the importance of maintaining an apolitical stance in bitcoin development for the safety and integrity of the network [source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/code-of-conduct-violation-banning-antoine-riard-for-3-months/1254/2).

recent_posts.title: Prevent future duplicate coinbase transactions as part of Consensus Cleanup
recent_posts.summary:
- Antoine Poinsot proposes solutions for Bitcoin's duplicate coinbase transactions issue.
- Proposed fixes aim to make future transactions distinguishable from early ones.
- Feedback from engineers and mining industry stakeholders is sought for these proposals.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core on ARM (Windows)
recent_posts.summary:
- Compiling Windows on ARM requires configuring gcc or clang without a unique ARM toolchain.
- Bitcoin core's development identifies x86-specific functions in the secp256k1 library, indicating a focus on libbitcoinkernel refinement.
- Integrating RISC-V support could significantly advance the bitcoin consensus engine's development process.

recent_posts.title: CTV, APO, CAT activity on signet
recent_posts.summary:
- A new tool for Bitcoin Inquisition transactions has been developed.
- It aims to simplify and enhance transaction analysis.
- The developer is seeking feedback for improvements.

recent_posts.title: Updates to the Gossip 1.75 proposal post LN summit meeting
recent_posts.summary:
- The unsigned TLV format for SPV proof is appreciated for its innovative approach.
- Concerns about the proposal suggest including the outpoint in signed fields to aid `txindex` nodes.
- Eclair team's readiness to develop features 1 and 2 depends on specification and lnd compatibility.

recent_posts.title: Code of Conduct Violation: Banning Antoine Riard for 3 months
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses professional reputation and the dynamics within the open-source community.
- It questions Matt Corallo's involvement in a dispute and Rusty Russell's conflict of interest.
- The sender advocates for integrity in open-source contributions and stresses ethical communication.

active_posts.title: Signing a Bitcoin Transaction with Lamport Signatures (no changes needed)
active_posts.summary:
- A new method for Bitcoin transactions utilizes Lamport signatures without needing OP_CAT.
- The technique involves using ECDSA signature lengths as proxies for transaction hashes for security.
- Despite its innovation, the scheme faces challenges like susceptibility to various attacks and requires refinement.

active_posts.title: Multi-byte opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- A new solution proposes multi-byte opcodes to expand Bitcoin's functionality without using NOPs.
- The approach, potentially named OP_OP, allows adding specific functions using three bytes.
- The proposal invites community feedback to enhance opcode functionality sustainably.

active_posts.title: CHECKSIGFROMSTACK(VERIFY/ADD)
active_posts.summary:
- Discussions on CHECKSIGFROMSTACK (CSFS) BIP highlight debates on including CSFSV in pre-tapscript versions.
- The potential addition of CHECKSIGFROMSTACKADD (CSFSA) aims to simplify script multisigs, reducing error and complexity.
- Brandon Black seeks feedback on CSFS improvements, emphasizing collaborative Bitcoin protocol development.

active_posts.title: OP_PAIRCOMMIT as a candidate for addition to LNhance
active_posts.summary:
- Pre-computing the Tag as a mid-state optimizes SHA256 iterations for LN-Symmetry.
- A proposed solution addresses length redistribution attacks via a custom hash function.
- Technical details and code adjustments are accessible in a GitHub pull request link.

active_posts.title: A Fast, Scalable Protocol For Resolving Lightning Payments
active_posts.summary:
- The OPR protocol resolves Lightning network payments quickly without on-chain transactions.
- It penalizes dishonest behavior, enhancing security and enabling small transactions.
- The protocol aims to improve scalability and accessibility in the Lightning Network.

active_posts.title: Channel depletion, LN Topology, Cycles and rational behavior of nodes
active_posts.summary:
- Recent research delves into Lightning Network's channel depletion using mathematical theory.
- Studies link network topology and economic rationality to predict and optimize fee potential.
- Future exploration to focus on liquidity management, spanning tree stability, and improved datasets.

today_in_history_posts.title: OP_CHECKWILDCARDSIGVERIFY or "Wildcard Inputs" or "Coalescing Transactions"
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Chris Priest proposes the OP_CHECKWILDCARDSIGVERIFY opcode to address small UTXOs and high fees.
- This opcode allows the creation of a coalescing transaction to merge UTXOs into one output.
- The solution aims to reduce transaction fees by combining multiple inputs into a single input.

today_in_history_posts.title: Payment channel without timeout protected from malleability
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- A new channel opening method prevents malleability attacks, inspired by gmaxwell.
- The process involves A asking B for a pubkey, creating, and sharing a commitment hash.
- After broadcasting and confirming the anchor, A reveals the anchor to B, ensuring security.

today_in_history_posts.title: Thoughts on scaling and consensus changes (2023)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin's scalability involves creating 50,000 off-chain "bitcoin banks" for mass transactions.
- Sidechains and coinpools offer solutions to reduce main chain transaction costs, enhancing scalability.
- Future development focuses on secure, efficient off-chain entities and protecting against supply chain attacks.
